summary: This is a detailed guide designed to very heavily mod Skyrim. It has been written so anyone with reasonable computer literacy can follow it, and no prior modding experienced is needed.
descriptionHtml:
AxonBitshift's Skyrim Modding Guide
v1.0 - Up-to-date as of April 2014


Welcome! I've written this guide because I couldn't find anything like it.


So what does this guide do differently?
- No prior modding experienced needed. Everything is explained from the ground up in as much detail as possible and to the best of my knowledge/ability. Of course, those with modding experience might pick up a few tips and tricks too!
- It's designed to be a step-by-step walkthough that anyone with decent computer literacy can easily follow.
- It's self-contained and can take you from a freshly installed Skyrim to a heavily modded and tested working game without the need for extensive research.
- Nothing has been left out unless it had to be. We will install hundreds of mods that significantly change and improve almost every aspect of the vanilla game.
- It has been written with as much flexibility as possible. You can pick and choose your mods based on your preferences and hardware.
- Mod Organizer, not the Nexus Mod Manger, is explained and used in this guide as it is massively more flexible.


What this guide is not:
- Simple. Nothing has been left out just because it's complicated.
- Quick. This guide will likely take 8+ hours to follow in its entirety (even if half that time is spent waiting for mods to download!).
- Small. I'm a wordy writer and there's hundreds of mods in this guide


Download this guide in the files tab and please endorse if you're happy with the result!


Note regarding the images: All screenshots have been taking using only the mods in this guide with the exception of Skyrim Bigger Trees (http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/17168/) which is also used in several screenshots. If you'd like to install it feel free but it does have some visual conflicts with Skyrim Flora Overhaul. I do not use any depth of field effects in my screenshots as it can often artificially enhance the appearance of the image by hiding the lower-quality objects in the distance.


I hope this guide helps you achieve a stable and amazing Skyrim experience!
-AxonBitshift
author: AxonBitshift
